column3: str
<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>!? What an honor to speak with you! If you have any questions, I should be glad to answer them!
What will you ask about?
Tell me about yourself.
Sinus Ardorum.
The Cosmoor.
Calabash Cove.
Weddingway's Bower.
Gleamslope.
The lunar nadir.
The Moongate Hub facilities.
Nothing.

I was a researcher's assistant in charge of filing documents at the Archeion. When I learned of the Cosmic Exploration Initiative, I knew at once that I wished to take part─to lend my expertise to the cause.
And I'm not the only one. You'll find many of those here are scholars who previously had a hand in planning the great exodus. Surprisingly, the work is scarcely any different.
Of course, I never dared dream that I would travel to the moon and meet the Loporrits! Scarcely a dull moment around here, and no shortage of friendly faces besides.
Sinus Ardorum is what we call this crater we occupy. Believe it or not, we've got a fairly stable living environment nestled in here.
They say that Namingway dreamt up the name and its meaning. Fitting, considering he did the same for countless landmarks in Mare Lamentorum some thousand years ago.
For a blessing, this place has ready access to stellar currents, making it an ideal port to harbor a starship! I'm told they're akin to the aetherial currents you might find back home.
The Cosmoor is the central sector of Sinus Ardorum where the Moongate Hub is situated. It's our gateway into space!
Here you'll find facilities like the Lunar Hopopolis, the cosmoports, and the crew's habitation modules. Lately it's starting to feel like a little village, almost...
You know, if our interstellar expeditions continue far into the future, perhaps one day this place will grow into a proper thriving harbor! I'd love to see it.
Calabash Cove is a smaller crater in the northwest sector of Sinus Ardorum, named for the bottle gourd shape of the local reservoir.
Nearly all of the moon's spring water is tainted with poisonous aetherochemicals, mind you, but luckily our rainbow crystal purifies that sort of thing.
We've documented rock formations rich in corrupted crystal clusters nearby─and they're slowly growing. Under the surface, the aetheric currents could very well be unstable.
Seen the bright pink moss, have you? It's an experimental garden designed to explore the unique attributes of a lunar ecosystem.
There's also an aetherochemical pool in the area that we call Palus Arsenici─the “marsh of arsenic.” It may look pretty, but that doesn't make it safe to play in.
Yet the native flora seem to thrive regardless... Have they the ability to filter the contaminants from the water? One of many things we're investigating!
Gleamslope is a smaller crater ensconced in a mountainous crystalline formation in the southwest sector of Sinus Ardorum. You can enter it through Piercingway Tunnel.
Inside, we've found debris seemingly Allagan in origin─and if our theory holds, it's connected to the Heimdall in Mare Lamentorum.
Perhaps the vessel broke into scattered pieces as it crashed? Incredible to think the effects of the Seventh Umbral Calamity rippled as far as the moon...
You've seen that canyon to the northeast, I take it? The lunar nadir refers to the cavern at the bottom. Just ride the nadir lift down to reach it!
It's like a whole different world down there. Jagged crystal clusters, spots of fungi growing all over the place, not to mention the aetherial falls...
That sort of isolated environment is ripe for experimentation, so we're planning a few tests. With any luck, the data may prove useful on other stars!
You'll have to be more specific! The hub has everything a settlement needs─power, water, you name it. Every facility here is controlled by the rainbow crystal.
This technology is truly first-rate─a perfect marriage of Loporrit magicks and Sharlayan brilliance! Every parameter is recorded automatically to improve efficiency.
Perhaps one day we'll have the means to predict what environments await us on other stars. Until then, there's much to be learned from the data we acquire here!
